question: Style of programming
Based on the concept of objects (state and behavior)
Utilizes control flow constructs.
Mimics a function in mathematics.
Uses facts and rules.
The implementation of the design phase in the SDLC
Translate source code (written in a programming language) into the computer language (object code)
Used in assembly language to convert the source code into the machine language
“reverse-engineer” the translation performed by compilers and assemblers
Translate source code into the target machine code “on-the-fly” (reads source code, converts it and executes it directly)
Obfuscators are used to reduce the size of a program’s source code without modifying the program's functionality.
Obfuscators perform deliberate modifications to program code to make it more difficult to understand, without changing the code’s functionality.
Code Beautifier is used to improve the presentation of source code for purposes of readability and conformance to some coding standards.
Code Minifier is used to reduce the size of a program’s source code without modifying the program’s functionality.
Transpiler translate source code into the target machine code “on-the-fly” (reads source code, converts it and executes it directly).
Refactoring is a disciplined technique for restructuring an existing body of code, altering its internal structure without changing its external behavior.
Software decay refers to the gradual deterioration of software over time or its decreasing inability to respond to its changing environment.
There is only one type of testing.
Debugging involves finding and removing bugs.
Most IDEs don’t provide a programmer with a debugger tool in performing debugging.
